items.q: Fill in the blank: She ___ already ___ her homework.
Fill in the blank: I ___ never ___ to Japan.
Choose the sentence in the present perfect tense.
Choose the sentence in the past perfect tense.
options: She has finished her work before lunch.
She had finished her work before lunch.
She finished her work before lunch.
She will have finished her work before lunch.

items.q: Fill in the blank: By 2010, they ___ in this city for ten years.
Fill in the blank: We ___ just ___ dinner when they arrived.
Choose the sentence in the future perfect tense.
options: She will have finished by 5 p.m.

items.q: Identify the incorrect use of a perfect tense.
options: I have visited that museum twice.
By the time we arrived, the show had started.
Next year, I will have worked here for ten years.
Yesterday, I have finished my project.

items.q: Fill in the blank: He ___ already ___ the report before the meeting.
Fill in the blank: By next month, we ___ here for a year.
Choose the best option: 'She ___ three novels so far.'
Identify the sentence with correct present perfect usage.
options: I have finished my work yesterday.
I have finished my work already.
I had finished my work now.
I will have finished my work yesterday.

items.q: Fill in the blanks: 'They ___ never ___ such a difficult exam before.'
Choose the sentence with correct past perfect usage.
options: By the time we got to the station, the train left.
By the time we got to the station, the train had left.
By the time we get to the station, the train had left.
By the time we get to the station, the train leaves.

items.q: Fill in the blank: She ___ just ___ her keys.
Fill in the blank: I ___ already ___ that movie.
Identify the sentence in the future perfect tense.
options: By tomorrow, I will finish this.
By tomorrow, I will have finished this.
By tomorrow, I have finished this.
By tomorrow, I had finished this.

items.q: Fill in the blank: When we arrived, they ___ already ___ eating.
Choose the best completion: 'By the end of this year, she ___ at this company for twenty years.'
In the sentence 'I have lived here since 2010', which tense is used and what does it show?
options: Present perfect; an action that started in the past and continues now.
Past perfect; an action completed before another past action.
Future perfect; an action completed before a future time.
Simple past; a finished action with no connection to now.
